website_summaries.verdict: Choose this sturdy canoe if you want one that isn't too short or too long, and still has space for people and items.
pros: Made by a top name in canoes in a 14-foot length that is ideal for anyone who prefers a mid-sized canoe, yet it still offers 3 seats and ample room for gear
cons: Rare quality control issues upon delivery have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on the recommended package deal. Not a deal. Just a hassle.
customer_reviews.text: Do not by the recommended package offered with this canoe. The seats in the package do not fit the canoe benches. No way to get the straps long enough to secure to the bench. Amazon needs to check this out before they sell it as a full ready to go package. Now we have the hassle of repackaged the seats and sending them back🙁and we have no back support while fishing in our new canoe
customer_reviews.author: Dale S.

customer_reviews.title: camping worthy
customer_reviews.text: we love this canoe not to big for me and my husband to handle. Does well in the lakes in Ca. will be trying the american river soon.
customer_reviews.author: Linda & Robert Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Canoe has no cooler, cupholders. no place to secure battery
customer_reviews.text: As another customer said, there is no cooler under any seat. What appears to be cuphoders are fishing rod holders with holes too small for any cup or can. The transom appears study enough for a small electric trolling motor but there is no provision for tying down a storage battery to power the motor, so what good is the square stern and transom? I recommend the KI industries 156 instead. It does have a cooler under the center seat. It does have cup holders. It is 1.5 feet longer for more stability and it is available from Walmart for about $450.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: big canoe
customer_reviews.text: come quick real nice havnt tried it yet but looks real nice bigger than you think seems to be well made
customer_reviews.author: Wayne L. Abner

customer_reviews.title: wrong description on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has an incorrect description of this canoe. The 14 ft. model DOES NOT have a cooler beneath center seat nor does it have a waterproof storage cup. The 15 ft. 6" model does, but not the 14 ft. I would have bought the canoe anyway but was disappointed to find out the cooler and storage cup was not on this model. I am sure it is a simple mistake but needs to be corrected. The price was an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: square stern canoe
customer_reviews.text: Canoe arrived with a dent in it, missing features: dry storage area,stern tie down, under seat cooler. All screws were half in, rear transport handle, connected at one point, all had to be screwed in. The most important thing is stability and ease to transport, it does the job with flying colors. I can see the screws being loose due to the truck shipment, along with the dent. It's plastic and the dent popped out, but the other advertised features missing thats purely BS, if your not going to put them on the canoe, then don't include them.
customer_reviews.author: jbc

customer_reviews.title: bought it cheaper at Dunhams
customer_reviews.text: Bought it at Dunhams for $308, after PA tax.... anchored it to a Honda Fit using a 30 foot dog lead, and 3 bungee straps.. Don't pay this much, unless you love blowing wads of cashola, or physically cannot pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: footmasterofdoom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Canoe!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat for the price a while ago at Dicks. $299. Added a 40lb thrust Minnkota and hit the water. Fits the 3 of us fine. It weighs 84lbs. Best for 2 people to carry. Nice and quite when fishing along the banks with a very shallow draft. Car top launch. 14' does require registration, no biggie though. A drawback on the hard plastic seats that dont fit traditional aftermarket add on canoe (bleacher seat) style seating. I found the GCI sitbacker with extension strap will work.
customer_reviews.author: Newguy

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend! We received this as a prank gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend! We received this as a prank gift for our wedding and ended up using it and loving it! Extremely spacious and stable (my husband decided to stand up and he didn’t slip us), has built in oar holders, built in fishing rod holders, a bench seat with a built in cooler, and was very easy to put in the water and go as is.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable value at Dunhams
customer_reviews.text: I just brought this canoe home. Haven't had it in the water, but it represents such an outstanding value at $279.00, that I felt compelled to share. This is the fulfillment of my hope to have something that can transport grandchild, dog, and me onto a local lake, only a mile from the condo. With a fixed income of a retired person; it's a no-brainer to take the chance. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad Deal.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sundolphin SS about three weeks ago. I had it out on the water last weekend and was pleased by the experiance. Handled smoothly in the water and with me rideing solo it was very stable. The canoe had plenty of extra cargo room and with 6 fishing rod holders haveing multiple fishing rods in the water was simple. The only complaint that I can think of is it was missing a "rivet" on one side the gunrail when I brought it home. Overall it seems to be well worth the money. Other online reviews I have read say that "plastic canoes" should last 10-15years with proper care-storage. Cant really go wrong with this canoe for under $500.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great canoe
customer_reviews.text: Great canoe for my little family! Sturdy and practical for our use. We got it for $287 plus tax at Dunham's Sports. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Material scratches and cuts easily.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from different source. Boat does not have durability for lakes and rivers with rocky bottoms. Material scratches and cuts easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mardock

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I don't own one of these, but they can be had at a sporting goods store cheaper than this. Found one at Dunham's Sports for under $400...
customer_reviews.author: tnbiker606

product_meta.title: Sun Dolphin Scout SS Canoe (Green, 14-Feet)
product_meta.description:
Not fond of paddling? Motor optional. The Water Quest Square Back Canoe steers and maneuvers like a regular canoe but has the benefit of a built-in motor transom. Trolling motor sold separately. •Steers and maneuvers like a regular canoe with the built-in benefit of a transom (motor not included) •Durable high-density polyethylene hull •Ideally suited for electric trolling motors •Sturdy square back transom •Capacity for three •Comfortable molded-in seats aid in flotation •Built-in rod holder locations •CE Rated.


***Important information when placing your order***


Please verify address and telephone# are accurate. The carriers will contact the phone number on the order to set up a delivery appointment. If this information is inaccurate, there is a possibility that your order will be delayed or cancelled with a possible fee incurred at the sellers discretion.
feature_bullets: Square stern design provides the electric trolling motor with a sturdy transom (motor not included)
***IMPORTANT – phone number is needed to schedule a delivery appointment***
